channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned bike, 8th November
item.description:
This bike has a council note saying it was being removed in April, I have reported it twice, it is still there! Obstructing the path way. Please remove. My next step will have to be to report this further up if this is ignored yet again, please remove this

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Shakspeare Walk, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Panels of flat pack furniture, 8th November
item.description:
Dumped on pavement on Chartham Grove se27. This seems to have become a popular spot to dump stuff. It's the second piece of furniture dumped there recently.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chartham Grove, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 55 Lime Bikes, 8th November
item.description:
Impossible to live in our flat with 55 Lime Bikes squashed into the bay and overflowing on the double yellow lines, the resident only parking bay and the pay and display. Emergency vehicles get blocked and the constant alarms going off is ridiculous. It’s an environmental nightmare. Please collect at least 40 of them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Church Row, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of smelly clothes dumped on Ethelbert Rd, 8th November
item.description:

item.title: Outside 66, 8th November
item.description:
Tree is dangerous with huge branches falling onto the payment and street, damaging cars. This was reported in April, ref 7490217. Camden tree department told us that it will be trimmed substantially in October. This has not happened. This is an urgent issue and we need to know when the tree will be substantially trimmed. It is already overdue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrim's Lane, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy metal cover, 8th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Mortimer Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster

item.title: Garden waste bins filled with household rubbish, 8th November
item.description:
Outside 115-117 Foulden Road there is a lot of rubbish that remains uncleared. It is stuffed into the garden waste bins or placed around them. There is often a lot of litter around the bins too. It has been like this for several months now, getting worse

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Foulden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement sunk below road level, 8th November
item.description:
This is an ongoing problem that has not been resolved. The pavement has sunk below the level of the roadbed level leaving protruding kerbstones, broken pavement, dip in the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Askern Close, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Area in complete darkness, 8th November
item.description:
All lighting is out on both sides of the A bridge. This is the only pedestrian route to north Thamesmead. It feels very unsafe
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car with no MOT, 8th November
item.description:
This is the third vehicle left in or opposite Matfield Close in a month. Both previous abandoned untaxed vans have finally been removed We now have a car abandoned that has no MOT We have insufficient parking spaces as it is as many houses have no drives. Please can you investigate V v frustrating

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Matfield Close, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet
